So if someone voluntarily gets drunk, they can't claim that as an excuse for their actions. But wait, there's also the concept of self-defense. If the defendant was defending themselves, they might not be guilty. But I need to check if the situation qualifies as self-defense.

The man insulted the defendant first. The defendant ignored the insult and tried to walk away. Then the man pushed him. So the man escalated the situation by pushing.
